title: How to Make Galaxy Ice Cream

steps.headline: In a large bowl, beat the whipping cream using an electric mixer.
steps.description: Mix until it's fluffy and light peaks form.

steps.headline: Pour in the milk and vanilla.
steps.description: Blend using the electric mixer until well combined.

steps.headline: Separate the cream mixture into several bowls.
Add the food coloring.
steps.description: In each bowl, add about 10-13 drops of food coloring. Stir with a spoon until the color is vibrant and vivid.

steps.headline: Pour each colored cream into a container.
steps.description: Spread and pour each colored cream into a large freezer-proof container. Use a wooden stick to mix the colors together.

steps.headline: Sprinkle edible glitter all over, if desired.
Freeze the ice cream for 3 hours till overnight.
Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the ice cream into a serving bowl. Garnish with extra edible glitter if desired. Enjoy!

text: Ice Cream with Food Coloring In a large bowl, beat the whipping cream using an electric mixer. Mix until it's fluffy and light peaks form. Pour in the milk and vanilla. Blend using the electric mixer until well combined. Separate the cream mixture into several bowls.  Add the food coloring. In each bowl, add about 10-13 drops of food coloring. Stir with a spoon until the color is vibrant and vivid. Pour each colored cream into a container. Spread and pour each colored cream into a large freezer-proof container. Use a wooden stick to mix the colors together. Sprinkle edible glitter all over, if desired.  Freeze the ice cream for 3 hours till overnight.  Serve. Scoop the ice cream into a serving bowl. Garnish with extra edible glitter if desired. Enjoy! Ice Cream with Fruit Juice In a large bowl, beat the whipping cream using an electric mixer. Beat and mix until it's fluffy and light peaks form. Pour in the milk and vanilla. Blend using the electric mixer until well combined. Separate the cream mixture into several bowls.  Add the fruit juice. In each bowl, add about 4–5 tablespoons (59–74 ml) of fruit juice. Stir with a spoon until the color is vibrant and vivid. Pour each colored cream into a container. Spread and pour each colored cream into a large freezer-proof container. Use a wooden stick to mix the colors together. Sprinkle edible glitter all over, if desired.  Freeze the ice cream for 3 hours till overnight.  Serve. Scoop the ice cream into a serving bowl. Garnish with extra edible glitter if desired. Enjoy!
